Instance.description: A zone director that controls a secret lab in a strange world.

Tunable.name: churn_alarm_interval
Tunable.description: Number sim minutes to check to make sure shifts and churn are being accurate.

TunableTuple.name: door_lock_operations
TunableTuple.description: These operations are applied to doors that should be locked based on the progress into the zone.

TunableTuple.name: lock_data
TunableTuple.description: The LockDoor loot to run on the doors in the lab to lock them.

TunableTuple.name: chance
TunableTuple.description: Percent chance that the loot action will be considered. The chance is evaluated just before running the tests.

Tunable.name: base_chance
Tunable.description: The basic chance of success.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_chance.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_chance if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableEnum.name: clear_existing_locks
TunableEnum.description: Which locks should be cleared before adding the new lock data.

TunableTuple.name: lock_all_with_genus_exception
TunableTuple.description: Lock all Sims except those that match the tuned genus.

TunableVariant.name: ages
TunableVariant.description: The Sim must be one of the specified ages.

TunableList.name: specified
TunableList.description: The Sim must be one of the specified ages.

TunableVariant.name: gender
TunableVariant.description: The Sim must be of the specified gender.

TunableEnum.name: specified
TunableEnum.description: The Sim must be of the specified gender.

TunableEnum.name: lock_priority
TunableEnum.description: The priority of this lock data. Used in comparison between multiple lock datas on the lock component test.

TunableEnum.name: lock_sides
TunableEnum.description: Which side or both this lock data will lock.

TunableEnum.name: match_type
TunableEnum.description: If MATCH_ALL is set, test will pass if Sim matches with all enabled tuned genus. If MATCH_ANY is set, test will pass if Sim matches with one of the enabled tuned genus.

Tunable.name: should_persist
Tunable.description: If checked, this lock data will be persisted.

TunableVariant.name: species
TunableVariant.description: The Sim must be one of the specified species.

TunableList.name: specified
TunableList.description: The Sim must be one of the specified species.

TunableTuple.name: lock_all_with_simid_exception
TunableTuple.description: The lock data will reject anyone who's not in the exception sim id list.

Tunable.name: except_actor
Tunable.description: If we want this lock data to have this actor as exception sim.

Tunable.name: except_household
Tunable.description: If we want this lock data to have actor's household as exception sims.

TunableEnum.name: lock_priority
TunableEnum.description: The priority of this lock data. Used in comparison between multiple lock datas on the lock component test.

TunableEnum.name: lock_sides
TunableEnum.description: Which side or both this lock data will lock.

Tunable.name: remove_sim_exception
Tunable.description: Removes subject sim from the list of exception sims.

Tunable.name: should_persist
Tunable.description: If checked, this lock data will be persisted.

TunableTuple.name: lock_all_with_situation_job_exception
TunableTuple.display: Lock All With Situation Job Exception

Tunable.name: except_business_employee
Tunable.description: If true, the business store employee will have exception to the door.

TunableEnum.name: lock_priority
TunableEnum.description: The priority of this lock data. Used in comparison between multiple lock datas on the lock component test.

TunableEnum.name: lock_sides
TunableEnum.description: Which side or both this lock data will lock.

Tunable.name: should_persist
Tunable.description: If checked, this lock data will be persisted.

TunableTuple.name: situation_job_test
TunableTuple.description: The test to determine whether this sim can pass or not.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked then the test result will be reversed, so it will test to see if they are not in a job or not in role state that has matching tags.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The subject of this situation job test.

TunableList.name: role_tags
TunableList.description: The participant must have a job that matches the role_tags or have the situation_job.

TunableList.name: situation_jobs
TunableList.description: The participant must have this job in this list or a job that matches the role_tags.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reason of failure.

TunableTuple.name: lock_creature
TunableTuple.description: Lock specific creature types.

TunableList.name: creature_types
TunableList.description: The creature types that this lock data applies to.

TunableEnum.name: lock_priority
TunableEnum.description: The priority of this lock data. Used in comparison between multiple lock datas on the lock component test.

TunableEnum.name: lock_sides
TunableEnum.description: Which side or both this lock data will lock.

Tunable.name: should_persist
Tunable.description: If checked, this lock data will be persisted.

TunableTuple.name: lock_ranked_statistic
TunableTuple.description: The lock data represent ranked statistic test. Sim that can pass the the ranked statistic test on the data can pass this lock.

TunableEnum.name: lock_priority
TunableEnum.description: The priority of this lock data. Used in comparison between multiple lock datas on the lock component test.

TunableEnum.name: lock_sides
TunableEnum.description: Which side or both this lock data will lock.

TunableTuple.name: rank_threshold
TunableTuple.description: Sims that have ranked statistic's value inside the threshold are not locked by the portal.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The number that describes the threshold.

Tunable.name: ranked_stat
Tunable.description: The ranked statistic we are operating on. Sims won't be allowed to traverse if they don't have this statistic.

Tunable.name: should_persist
Tunable.description: If checked, this lock data will be persisted.

Tunable.name: replace_same_lock_type
Tunable.description: If True, it will replace the same type of lock data in the locking component, otherwise it will update the existing data.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The sim(s) the operation is applied to.

TdescFragTag.name: subject_filter_tests
TdescFragTag.description: These tests will be run once per subject. If the subject participant of this loot action resolves to multiple objects, each of those objects will be tested individually. Any subject that fails this test will be ignored by this loot. This will have no effect on whether we consider the loot to have passed testing on on other subjects or targets. We can use this in cases where we want to give loot based on some criteria like 'All active household members that are dogs get this loot'. These tests will have no effect on 'run tests first' as they are only used for participant filtering and not to determine loot success. The resolver used for these tests is a SingleObjectResolver based on subject sim. This means that test should generally be testing against 'Actor' and should not assume the presence of additional participants that may be present in the containing loot. Ask a GPE if you have questions.

TdescFragTag.name: target_filter_tests
TdescFragTag.description: As subject filter tests, except per target object. See description of subject filter tests.

TunableEnum.name: target_participant_type
TunableEnum.description: The object to lock.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: The test to decide whether the loot action can be applied.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used. e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications. e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

Tunable.name: object_state
Tunable.description: An object state that should be set on the door when locked.

TunableTuple.name: door_unlock_operations
TunableTuple.description: These operations are applied to doors that should be unlocked based on the progress into the zone.

TunableTuple.name: lock_data
TunableTuple.description: The UnlockDoor loot to run on the doors when they should be unlocked.

TunableTuple.name: chance
TunableTuple.description: Percent chance that the loot action will be considered. The chance is evaluated just before running the tests.

Tunable.name: base_chance
Tunable.description: The basic chance of success.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_chance.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_chance if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The sim(s) the operation is applied to.

TdescFragTag.name: subject_filter_tests
TdescFragTag.description: These tests will be run once per subject. If the subject participant of this loot action resolves to multiple objects, each of those objects will be tested individually. Any subject that fails this test will be ignored by this loot. This will have no effect on whether we consider the loot to have passed testing on on other subjects or targets. We can use this in cases where we want to give loot based on some criteria like 'All active household members that are dogs get this loot'. These tests will have no effect on 'run tests first' as they are only used for participant filtering and not to determine loot success. The resolver used for these tests is a SingleObjectResolver based on subject sim. This means that test should generally be testing against 'Actor' and should not assume the presence of additional participants that may be present in the containing loot. Ask a GPE if you have questions.

TdescFragTag.name: target_filter_tests
TdescFragTag.description: As subject filter tests, except per target object. See description of subject filter tests.

TunableEnum.name: target_participant_type
TunableEnum.description: The object to unlock.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: The test to decide whether the loot action can be applied.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used. e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications. e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableVariant.name: unlock_creature_types
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, define the creature types that for which this unlock will apply

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: List of creature types to apply the unlock to if LockType is LOCK_CREATURE.

TunableVariant.name: unlock_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of the lock we want to remove, by default should be everything.

Tunable.name: object_state
Tunable.description: An object state that should be set on the door when unlocked.

TunableList.name: object_commodities_to_fixup_on_load
TunableList.display: Object Commodities To Fixup On Load
TunableList.description: Normally object commodities retain their previously saved value on load and do not simulate the decay up to the current time. This list allows specific objects to update commodities based off passage of time if time had elapsed between load and the last time the zone was saved.

Tunable.name: commodity
Tunable.description: The commodity to fix up if time elapsed since zone was last saved.

TunableTuple.name: object_test
TunableTuple.description: Test whether or not an object applies for this fixup.

TunableVariant.name: item
TunableVariant.description: Whether to test for a specific item or item that has a set of tags

TunableTuple.name: actual_item
TunableTuple.description: This option tests crafted item against a list of possible items

Tunable.description: Object that qualifies for this check.

TunableTuple.name: tagged_item
TunableTuple.description: This option tests crafted item's tags against a list of possible tags

TunableList.name: tag_set
TunableList.description: The tag of objects we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reason of failure.

TunableTuple.name: reveal_interactions
TunableTuple.description: Interactions that, when run on a door, reveal the plex associated to the interacted door.

TunableList.name: affordances
TunableList.description: The Sim must have started either any affordance in this list or an interaction matching one of the tags in this tunable's Tags field.

TunableList.name: tags
TunableList.description: The Sim must have run either an interaction matching one of these Tags or an affordance from the list of Affordances in this tunable.

TunableList.name: section_doors
TunableList.description: An ordered set of doors, each of which unlocks a section of the lab to explore.

TunableVariant.name: set_host_as
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, we will set a host sim (aka Requesting Sim) for the situations being started. The host sim can influence the default guest list for the situation, if we do not have a premade guest list. Most of the time this should be the Active Sim. In the case of Object Situation Shifts only, select SimFromObject if you want to set the host sim as the sim stored on the object (e.g. the ghost associated with an urnstone).

Tunable.name: set_host_as_active_sim
Tunable.description: DEPRECATED-- use Set Host As instead. If Set Host As is enabled, it will OVERRIDE this setting. If checked then the active Sim will be set as the host of situations started from this director if we do not have a pre-made guest list.

TunableList.name: situation_shifts
TunableList.description: A list of situation distributions and their strictness rules.

TunableList.name: additional_sources
TunableList.description: Any additional sources of NPCs that we want to use to add into the possible situations of this shift curve.

TunableVariant.description: The different additional situation sources that we want to use to get additional situation possibilities that can be chosen.

TunableTuple.name: holiday
TunableTuple.description: Use Situations from the tuned Holiday Walkbys.

TunableTuple.name: narrative
TunableTuple.description: Get situations from active narratives.

TunableEnum.name: narrative_situation_shift_type
TunableEnum.description: Shift type to look for.

TunableTuple.name: zone_modifier
TunableTuple.description: Use Situations from a specific Zone modifier.

Tunable.name: zone_modifier
Tunable.description: The zone modifier that we want to get the

Tunable.name: count_based_on_expected_sims
Tunable.description: If checked then we will count based on the number of Sims that are expected to be in the Situation rather than the number of situations. NOTE if this is checked, your situation MUST have get_sims_expected_to_be_in_situation() implemented by a GPE. Otherwise the situation will not start.

TunableVariant.name: shift_curve
TunableVariant.description: A container for specifying the desired amount of certain situations at specific times of day/week.

TunableTuple.name: curve_based
TunableTuple.description: A situation curve defines the desired amount of certain situations at specific times of the day.

TunableTuple.name: desired_sim_count_multipliers
TunableTuple.description: Tunable tested multiplier to apply to the desired sim count.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableList.name: entries
TunableList.description: A list of tuples declaring a relationship between days of the week and desire curves.

TunableTuple.description: The first value is the day of the week that maps to a desired curve of population by time of the day. days_of_the_week population_desire_by_time_of_day M,Th,F time_curve_1 W,Sa time_curve_2 By production/design request we do not support multiple population curves for the same day. e.g. if you want something special to occur at noon on a Wednesday, make a unique curve for Wednesday and apply the changes to it.

TunableTuple.name: days_of_the_week
TunableTuple.description: Which days of the week to include

TunableList.name: walkby_desire_by_time_of_day
TunableList.display: Walkby Desire By Time Of Day
TunableList.description: Each entry in the map has two columns. The first column is the hour of the day (0-24) that maps to a desired list of population (second column). The entry with starting hour that is closest to, but before the current hour will be chosen. Given this tuning: hour_of_day desired_situations 6 [(w1, s1), (w2, s2)] 10 [(w1, s2)] 14 [(w2, s5)] 20 [(w9, s0)] if the current hour is 11, hour_of_day will be 10 and desired is [(w1, s2)]. if the current hour is 19, hour_of_day will be 14 and desired is [(w2, s5)]. if the current hour is 23, hour_of_day will be 20 and desired is [(w9, s0)]. if the current hour is 2, hour_of_day will be 20 and desired is [(w9, s0)]. (uses 20 tuning because it is not 6 yet) The entries will be automatically sorted by time.

TunableTuple.name: desired_walkby_situations
TunableTuple.description: Tuning that expresses a desire to populate the world with a specific number of Sims and associating them with an entry from available weighted situations.

TunableVariant.name: desired_sim_count
TunableVariant.description: The number of Sims desired to be participating in the situation.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A literal value that is to be used as the lower and upper bound of an interval. This allows both literal and range interval tunings in the same TunableVariant without having to manually set the lower and upper bounds to the same value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The upper and lower bounds.

TunableTuple.name: random_in_range
TunableTuple.description: A tunable interval between lower_bound and upper_bound.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: disable_churn
Tunable.description: If checked, we disable churn for this shift change. That means we only fire the situation on shift change, not in between shifts. So if you have a situation in this shift and it ends, we don't spin up another one on the next churn (based on churn interval). Basically means you want a one shot situation, fire and forget. If unchecked, we will try to maintain the desired number of situations at every churn interval during this shift change.

TunableList.name: weighted_situations
TunableList.description: A weighted list of situations to be used while fulfilling the desired Sim count.

TunableTuple.name: params
TunableTuple.description: Situation creation parameters.

Tunable.name: user_facing
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will start the situation as user facing. Note: We can only have one user facing situation at a time, so make sure you aren't tuning multiple user facing situations to occur at once.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A set of tests that must pass for the situation and weight pair to be available for selection. *IMPORTANT* The only participants that work are ones available globally, such as Lot and ActiveHousehold. Only use these participant types or use tests that don't rely on any, such as testing all objects via Object Criteria test or testing active zone with the Zone test.

TunableTuple.name: weight_multipliers
TunableTuple.description: Tunable tested multiplier to apply to weight. *IMPORTANT* The only participants that work are ones available globally, such as Lot and ActiveHousehold. Only use these participant types or use tests that don't rely on any, such as testing all objects via Object Criteria test or testing active zone with the Zone test.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableTuple.name: shiftless
TunableTuple.description: A listed of weighted situations that will be chosen that will not end based of shift change.

TunableTuple.name: _desired_situations
TunableTuple.description: Tuning that expresses a desire to populate the world with a specific number of Sims and associating them with an entry from available weighted situations.

TunableVariant.name: desired_sim_count
TunableVariant.description: The number of Sims desired to be participating in the situation.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A literal value that is to be used as the lower and upper bound of an interval. This allows both literal and range interval tunings in the same TunableVariant without having to manually set the lower and upper bounds to the same value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The upper and lower bounds.

TunableTuple.name: random_in_range
TunableTuple.description: A tunable interval between lower_bound and upper_bound.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

So if you have a situation in this shift and it ends, we don't spin up another one on the next churn (based on churn interval). Basically means you want a one shot situation, fire and forget. If unchecked, we will try to maintain the desired number of situations at every churn interval during this shift change.

TunableList.name: weighted_situations
TunableList.description: A weighted list of situations to be used while fulfilling the desired Sim count.

TunableTuple.name: params
TunableTuple.description: Situation creation parameters.

Tunable.name: user_facing
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will start the situation as user facing. Note: We can only have one user facing situation at a time, so make sure you aren't tuning multiple user facing situations to occur at once.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A set of tests that must pass for the situation and weight pair to be available for selection. *IMPORTANT* The only participants that work are ones available globally, such as Lot and ActiveHousehold. Only use these participant types or use tests that don't rely on any, such as testing all objects via Object Criteria test or testing active zone with the Zone test.

TunableTuple.description: Tunable tested multiplier to apply to weight. *IMPORTANT* The only participants that work are ones available globally, such as Lot and ActiveHousehold. Only use these participant types or use tests that don't rely on any, such as testing all objects via Object Criteria test or testing active zone with the Zone test.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableTuple.name: desired_sim_count_multipliers
TunableTuple.description: Tunable tested multiplier to apply to the desired sim count.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableEnum.name: shift_strictness
TunableEnum.description: Determine how situations on shift will be handled on shift change. Example: I want 3 customers between 10-12. then after 12 I want only 1. Having this checked will allow 3 customers to stay and will let situation duration kick the sim out when appropriate. This will not create new situations if over the cap.

TunableList.name: situations_on_load
TunableList.description: Situations that are always started when the zone director loads and are only shut down by the zone director when the zone director shuts down (although they can still end by other means). Because these situations are always restarted, it is invalid to schedule situations with a positive persistence option here (ask a GPE if you need to determine a situation's persistence option).
